meanings.sent1: The stithy was filled with the sound of hammers on metal.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith spent hours working in his stithy.
meanings.sent3: The stithy was so busy that the blacksmith had to dance around to avoid bumping into others.
meanings.sent4: The stithy was a hive of activity, with sparks flying in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The stithy smelled of burning coal and hot metal, a symphony of industry.

meanings.definition: To forge or shape metal in a blacksmith's workshop.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith used the hammer to stithy the red-hot iron into shape.
meanings.sent2: He loved to stithy intricate designs into the metal.
meanings.sent3: The blacksmith accidentally stithied his thumb instead of the metal.
meanings.sent4: She stithied the metal with precision, creating a beautiful piece of art.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic clang of the hammer stithying the metal echoed through the stithy.
